page.title: 04Local History
page.content: {The church of St.Ippolyts}stands at the top of a small hill in surprisingly dramatic natural {surroundings.The core of the church {itself is Norman and dates back to the {late eleventh or twelfth {century.However,it}has been subject to a series of fundamental alterations:an {extension to the chancel}in the thirteenth century;the great {enlargement of the building}during the fourteenth and the{addition of the {north and south porches in the {Perpendicular style}of the fifteenth century. Prompted by decay an extraordinarily competent wholesale reconstruction of the structure(with the notable exception of the tower)was undertaken in 1878 using original materials.Furthermore,it is largely due to the success of this venture
